intro: Gratiola oresbia, commonly known as the narrowleaf pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Gratiola oresbia is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
